intro: Trichospermum talaudensis, commonly known as the Talaud Island milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Talaud Islands in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems. The plant produces capsules that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in coastal or sandy habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
